dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.
dependencies.name: cmake

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.
dependencies.name: ninja

dependent_to.description: Clingo with some options used for bootstrapping
dependent_to.name: clingo-bootstrap

dependent_to.description: C++ runtime system for parallel and distributed applications.
dependent_to.name: hpx

dependent_to.description: C++ runtime system for parallellism and concurrency.
dependent_to.name: pika

description:
mimalloc is a compact general purpose allocator with excellent
performance.
name: mimalloc

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: Build test executables
variants.name: build_tests

variants.description: CMake build type
variants.name: build_type

variants.description: Use full internal heap invariant checking in DEBUG mode (expensive)
variants.name: debug_full

variants.description: Build with thread sanitizer (needs clang)
variants.name: debug_tsan

variants.description: Build with undefined-behavior sanitizer (needs clang++)
variants.name: debug_ubsan

variants.description: the build system generator to use
variants.name: generator

variants.description: CMake interprocedural optimization
variants.name: ipo

variants.description: Build shared, static, or object libraries
variants.name: libs

variants.description: Use slightly slower, dlopen-compatible TLS mechanism (Unix)
variants.name: local_dynamic_tls

variants.description: Use interpose to override standard malloc on macOS
variants.name: osx_interpose

variants.description: Use malloc zone to override standard malloc on macOS
variants.name: osx_zone

variants.description: Override the standard malloc interface (e.g. define entry points for malloc() etc)
variants.name: override

variants.description: Enable padding to detect heap block overflow (used only in DEBUG mode)
variants.name: padding

variants.description: Use full security mitigations (like guard pages, allocation randomization, double-free mitigation, and free-list corruption detection)
variants.name: secure

variants.description: Generate assembly files
variants.name: see_asm

variants.description: Show error and warning messages by default (only enabled by default in DEBUG mode)
variants.name: show_errors

variants.description: Skip collecting memory on program exit
variants.name: skip_collect_on_exit

variants.description: Use the C++ compiler to compile the library (instead of the C compiler)
variants.name: use_cxx

variants.description: Enable abort() call on memory allocation failure by default
variants.name: xmalloc
